Posted By: marmaris74 (1/22/2013 5:11:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yes, with [Goblin War Paint](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin War Paint) as the precedent, plus the fact that WOTC has been pushing auras lately, this could have been two or even three mana cheaper. At this cost, I'd rather it gave   
something like trample instead.  
  
The problem with giving haste at such a high cost is that you probably won't have much mana to pay for the creature. Most creatures that cost 1-2 mana are no bigger than 2/2s, which would give you at best a 5/5 for 6 or 7 mana. And creatures higher on the curve mean you're playing the combo even later in the game, or having to ramp up to it. At such an investment, there are better things to cast (yes, even at common).
posts.html:
Yes, with Goblin War Paint as the precedent, plus the fact that WOTC has been pushing auras lately, this could have been two or even three mana cheaper. At this cost, I'd rather it gave
something like trample instead.

The problem with giving haste at such a high cost is that you probably won't have much mana to pay for the creature. Most creatures that cost 1-2 mana are no bigger than 2/2s, which would give you at best a 5/5 for 6 or 7 mana. And creatures higher on the curve mean you're playing the combo even later in the game, or having to ramp up to it. At such an investment, there are better things to cast (yes, even at common).

posts.post_content: All of the cards that currently want these effects are blue and white - [Academy Researchers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Academy Researchers), [Auratouched Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auratouched Mage), the blue ability from [Simic Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Guildmage) and to a lesser extant, [Evershrike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evershrike). Unless [Nomad Mythmaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nomad Mythmaker)-[Uril, the Mistsalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril, the Mistsalker) becomes a Modern combo, I don't get this. However, it could be like [Blessings of Nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessings of Nature), which made no sense as a card until you see cards like [Fathom Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fathom Mage) the following block...

posts.post_content:
This card is wrong on so many levels. When is Wizards going to learn that cards that give haste SHOULD cost less than what it should cost, especially when you know that it can be easily two-for-one'd.   
First let's examine the fact that it requires two colors. What else is an enchantment, is two colors and is just as good? Oh how about [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak). That aura has 3 abilities: +2/+2, trample AND lifelink.  
Now what does this 5 mana aura do? Give +3/+3 and haste. That's it? What about trample, something known to be in green and red? No instead we got an extra cost in mana, that's the ability, to get us to waste even more mana and turns to get to even cast this. And by the time we even cast it the other player(s) would already have an answer to it.  
And i don't you would need the haste part anyway. If you played this on a 1 mana creature you're paying 6 mana for a 4/4 haste, no let's give it the benefit of the doubt, a 5/4 haste, but remember it requires two cards. If... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
